definitions: the quality of being only a short distance away or apart in space or time

examples.text: the geographical closeness of our two countries
the translator's closeness to the original time period

shortDefinitions: quality of being only short distance away or apart in space or time

definitions: the state of being narrowly enclosed

examples.text: the claustrophobic closeness of the living quarters

definitions: the quality of having only a small margin between winner and loser

examples.text: the scoreline did not reflect the closeness of the contest

shortDefinitions: quality of having only a small margin between winner and loser

definitions: the quality of affection or intimacy in a relationship

examples.text: moments of closeness with friends and family members

shortDefinitions: the quality of affection or intimacy in a relationship

definitions: the quality or state of having a strong resemblance or connection

examples.text: apes are often selected due to their evolutionary closeness to humans

shortDefinitions: quality or state of having a strong resemblance or connection

definitions: the quality of being done in an attentive and thorough way

examples.text: the closeness with which he watched current events

shortDefinitions: quality of being done in careful and thorough way
